result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E Sims

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James E Sims appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annette E Rauch appeared by video for James E Sims.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective - N. Stachula.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James E Sims not in court, in custody.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for James E Sims.  Attorney Megan Marie Newport appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Sims is in custody in Waukesha, not produced for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James E Sims not in court, defendant in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Hartley appears on behalf of Annette Rauch. Court informed by PD's appointment office unable to appoint for today's hearing. Court finds county appointment appropriate. The court appointed Attorney Rauch to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to does not have to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Atty Hartley on behalf of Atty Rauch in court and accepts appointment. Case adjourned for prelim.

Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

*Defendant is in custody status. Court takes no further action at this time.

Defendant James E Sims not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant James E Sims in court by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr. Sims needs to be evaluated by SPD to determine his eligibility and is instructed to contact the SPD office to provide information to them. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant James E Sims in court, appear by video. Megan Marie Newport appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request this matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant James E Sims in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant James E Sims in court with attorney Michael G. Levine as friend to the court.  Defendant James E Sims in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James E Sims appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
